responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Path Traversal vulnerability in the codebase
    analysis: |
      The codebase contains a path traversal vulnerability in the following code:
      ```javascript
      app.get("*", async (_request, response) => {
          response.send(this.indexHTML);
      });
      ```
      This code allows a user to access any file on the server by modifying the URL. An attacker could potentially access sensitive files or execute unauthorized code on the server.
    cwe: CWE-22
    function_names:
      - get
    filenames:
      - backend/dockge-server.ts
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Injection vulnerability in the codebase
    analysis: |
      The codebase contains an injection vulnerability in the following code:
      ```javascript
      app.use(router.create(this.app, this));
      ```
      This code allows an attacker to inject malicious code into the application, which could be executed on the server. The attacker could potentially gain unauthorized access to the system or execute arbitrary commands.
    cwe: CWE-94
    function_names:
      - create
    filenames:
      - backend/router.ts
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Improper Input Validation vulnerability in the codebase
    analysis: |
      The codebase contains an improper input validation vulnerability in the following code:
      ```javascript
      socket.on("deployStack", async (name : unknown, composeYAML : unknown, composeENV : unknown, isAdd : unknown, callback) => {
          // ...
      });
      ```
      This code does not properly validate the input parameters, which could allow an attacker to inject malicious data and potentially execute arbitrary code on the server.
    cwe: CWE-20
    function_names:
      - deployStack
    filenames:
      - backend/socket-handlers/docker-socket-handler.ts
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the codebase
    analysis: |
      The codebase contains a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the following code:
      ```javascript
      socket.on("terminalInput", async (terminalName : unknown, cmd : unknown, errorCallback) => {
          // ...
      });
      ```
      This code does not properly sanitize the input parameters, which could allow an attacker to inject malicious JavaScript code that would be executed in the user's browser.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names:
      - terminalInput
    filenames:
      - backend/socket-handlers/terminal-socket-handler.ts
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption vulnerability in the codebase
    analysis: |
      The codebase contains an uncontrolled resource consumption vulnerability in the following code:
      ```javascript
      this.io = new socketIO.Server(this.httpServer, {
          cors,
      });
      ```
      This code does not limit the number of connections or the resources used by each connection, which could allow an attacker to overwhelm the server with a large number of connections, causing a Denial of Service (DoS) attack.
    cwe: CWE-400
    function_names:
      - constructor
    filenames:
      - backend/dockge-server.ts
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Improper Privilege Management vulnerability in the codebase
    analysis: |
      The codebase contains an improper privilege management vulnerability in the following code:
      ```javascript
      async afterLogin(socket : DockgeSocket, user : User) {
          socket.userID = user.id;
          socket.join(user.id.toString());
      }
      ```
      This code does not properly manage the user's privileges, which could allow an attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system or perform actions beyond their intended permissions.
    cwe: CWE-269
    function_names:
      - afterLogin
    filenames:
      - backend/dockge-server.ts
    classification: very promising
